question_text: In allometric scaling, Kleiber's law states that mammalian basal metabolic rate scales with body mass $M$ according to what exponent?
correct_answer: $M^{3/4}$, a sublinear power law known as quarter-power scaling
distractors: $M^{2/3}$, following the surface-area-to-volume ratio directly
$M^{1}$, scaling linearly and proportionally with total body mass
$M^{1/2}$, following a square-root relationship with body mass

question_text: In the renormalization group framework, what physical property explains why microscopically different systems exhibit identical critical exponents near phase transitions?
correct_answer: Universality: systems flow to the same RG fixed point, making microscopic details irrelevant
distractors: Equipartition: thermal energy distributes equally among all microscopic degrees of freedom at criticality
Ergodicity: phase-space trajectories eventually sample all accessible microstates uniformly near transitions
Duality: every lattice model maps exactly onto a complementary model at the inverse temperature

question_text: In algorithmic information theory, Chaitin's constant $\Omega$ represents what quantity, and why is it fundamentally unknowable?
correct_answer: The halting probability of a universal Turing machine; only finitely many of its digits are provable in any formal system
distractors: The maximum Kolmogorov complexity of any finite string; it grows faster than any computable function can bound
The ratio of compressible to incompressible strings; it converges too slowly for any algorithm to approximate
The Shannon entropy rate of random programs; its value depends on an unresolvable choice of programming language

question_text: According to Jaynes's maximum entropy principle, when only the mean energy $\langle E \rangle$ is known as a constraint, which probability distribution is uniquely selected?
correct_answer: The Boltzmann (canonical) distribution $p_i \propto e^{-\beta E_i}$, recovering statistical mechanics
distractors: The Gaussian distribution $p(E) \propto e^{-E^2/2\sigma^2}$, recovering the central limit theorem
The uniform (microcanonical) distribution over all states, recovering Laplace's principle of indifference
The power-law distribution $p(E) \propto E^{-\alpha}$, recovering self-organized criticality

question_text: In topological data analysis, what does persistent homology's "stability theorem" guarantee about persistence diagrams?
correct_answer: Small perturbations in input data produce only small changes in the persistence diagram under the bottleneck distance
distractors: Persistence diagrams converge to the true Betti numbers as sample size approaches infinity regardless of noise
Features with long persistence bars are guaranteed to represent genuine topological features rather than noise
Any two filtrations of the same simplicial complex produce identical persistence diagrams up to isomorphism

question_text: Arrow's impossibility theorem applies specifically to which type of voting system, and what class of systems escapes its conclusion?
correct_answer: It applies to ordinal (ranked) voting with three or more candidates; cardinal (rated) voting systems are not subject to it
distractors: It applies to plurality (first-past-the-post) voting only; any system using runoff rounds or elimination avoids the impossibility
It applies to all deterministic voting systems without exception; only randomized or lottery-based mechanisms can escape it
It applies to single-winner elections exclusively; any multi-winner system using proportional representation methods avoids it

question_text: In Hubbell's unified neutral theory of biodiversity, species abundances are governed by what key parameter $\theta$, and what does it combine?
correct_answer: The fundamental biodiversity number $\theta = 2J\nu$, combining metacommunity size $J$ and speciation rate $\nu$
distractors: The niche overlap index $\theta = S/K$, combining total species richness $S$ and carrying capacity $K$
The competitive exclusion parameter $\theta = r/d$, combining intrinsic growth rate $r$ and death rate $d$
The island isolation coefficient $\theta = A/D^2$, combining island area $A$ and distance $D$ from mainland

question_text: Goodhart's law originated in what specific policy domain, and who later generalized it into the widely-quoted formulation "When a measure becomes a target, it ceases to be a good measure"?
correct_answer: UK monetary policy (Charles Goodhart, 1975); generalized by Marilyn Strathern citing Keith Hoskin
distractors: US fiscal policy (Milton Friedman, 1968); generalized by Robert Lucas in his famous macroeconomic critique
Soviet industrial planning (Wassily Leontief, 1971); generalized by Donald Campbell in his social indicators law
British education reform (Michael Young, 1958); generalized by Peter Drucker in management-by-objectives theory

question_text: Herbert Simon's concept of satisficing is embedded within which broader theoretical framework, and how does it formally differ from optimizing?
correct_answer: Bounded rationality; agents select the first option meeting an aspiration threshold rather than maximizing a utility function
distractors: Prospect theory; agents weight losses more heavily than gains and settle for loss-avoidance rather than gain-seeking
Rational expectations; agents form optimal forecasts but accept suboptimal actions due to information transaction costs
Game theory; agents choose Nash equilibrium strategies that are stable rather than individually optimal payoff-maximizing

question_text: For maximum power transfer in a circuit with complex impedances, what specific relationship must hold between source and load impedance?
correct_answer: The load impedance must equal the complex conjugate of the source impedance: $Z_{\text{load}} = Z_{\text{source}}^*$
distractors: The load impedance must equal the source impedance exactly: $Z_{\text{load}} = Z_{\text{source}}$ including reactive parts
The load resistance must equal the source resistance while all reactance must be maximized for full resonance
The load impedance magnitude must equal the source impedance magnitude: $|Z_{\text{load}}| = |Z_{\text{source}}|$ only
